subject: Data
title: NewSQL: The Best of Both Worlds
description: A 60-second lesson on NewSQL: The Best of Both Worlds.

hook.text: What if you could have SQL's reliability AND NoSQL's scalability? That's what NewSQL databases promise.

buildup.text: NewSQL databases like CockroachDB and Google Spanner provide ACID guarantees while scaling across many servers.

discovery.text: Google Spanner uses atomic clocks and GPS to synchronize transactions across global data centers with microsecond.

twist.text: NewSQL requires exotic infrastructure. Spanner's atomic clocks cost Google millions ‚Äî not practical for most companies.

climax.text: NewSQL proves that the SQL-vs-NoSQL choice was a false dichotomy ‚Äî you can have both, at a price.

punchline.text: SQL wasn't the problem. Scaling it was. NewSQL solved the scaling.

quiz.question: What does NewSQL combine?
options: SQL's ACID reliability with NoSQL's horizontal scalability
